description: Students learn a widely-used  style of programming based on first order predicate logic.
Topics include declarative programming, Horn clauses, declarative and procedural
semantics of logic programs, clauses as relations, goals, backtracking, and resolution.
Programming projects and exercises use Prolog, the most significant logic programming
language. Additional topics include the relationship of Prolog to logic and applications
to artificial intelligence. Offered alternate years. Prerequisite: CSCI 251 or permission of
